channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why the build up of U.S. military forces continues in the Caribbean
item.description: U.S. forces are likely in places such as Puerto Rico for the long haul, as the Trump administration tries to reshape U.S. priorities in the Caribbean and South America.
item.content:encoded: U.S. forces are likely in places such as Puerto Rico for the long haul, as the Trump administration tries to reshape U.S. priorities in the Caribbean and South America.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Life, liberty and the very American pursuit of humor
item.description: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.content:encoded: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Former NATO chief on Europe and U.S. relations
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Anders Fogh Rasmussen, former prime minister of Denmark and former head of NATO, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Anders Fogh Rasmussen, former prime minister of Denmark and former head of NATO, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: Ice climbers welcome winter, finally
item.description: Unusually warm weather in the Rocky Mountains has meant the Ouray Ice Park in Colorado has been bare rock. Now that freezing temperatures have returned, there's a rush to scale the ice.
item.content:encoded: Unusually warm weather in the Rocky Mountains has meant the Ouray Ice Park in Colorado has been bare rock. Now that freezing temperatures have returned, there's a rush to scale the ice.
item.dc:creator: Stina Sieg

item.title: Israel's far-right dreams of rebuilding Gaza settlements
item.description: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza has been rejected by far-right Israeli officials who want the land for Jewish settlements.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza has been rejected by far-right Israeli officials who want the land for Jewish settlements.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Mothers in the U.S. use crowdfunding tactics to help families in war-torn Gaza
item.description: After connecting through social media, an informal network of moms started crowdfunding to help families in Gaza afford food and shelter.
item.content:encoded: After connecting through social media, an informal network of moms started crowdfunding to help families in Gaza afford food and shelter.
item.dc:creator: Beenish Ahmed

item.title: Do you have some bad habits? Good news — you can make new ones. Here's how
item.description: Research shows it helps to start small if you want new habits to stick.
item.content:encoded: Research shows it helps to start small if you want new habits to stick.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Tallulah Proulx is making history at the Winter Olympics
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: A researcher's effort to make edible cotton seeds
item.description: Edible cotton seeds could revolutionize the cotton industry. That's the goal of one researcher who says the seeds would be an inexpensive protein source that could help feed millions of people.
item.content:encoded: Edible cotton seeds could revolutionize the cotton industry. That's the goal of  one researcher who says the seeds would be an inexpensive protein source that could help feed millions of people.
item.dc:creator: Michael Marks

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.content:encoded: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Pupovac
